title: Same Effort, More Revenue: Why You Shouldn’t Wait for the "Perfect Time” to Automate Your Hotel Pricing
description: Same effort, more revenue: automate hotel pricing with RoomPriceGenie to optimise rates year-round, seize event demand and boost RevPAR
content: A common excuse for putting off technology is, “We’re too busy,” or “It’s not the right time.” But here’s the reality: there’s never a perfect time to make a change. This is especially true of a revenue management system (RMS). The longer a hotel waits to automate pricing, the more revenue opportunities slip away. And automation doesn’t add to your workload. It helps you work smarter, not harder. Once you make the switch, your only regret may be, “Why didn’t we do this sooner?” ## High Season: Are You Really Maximizing Revenue? “It’s high season. We’re fully booked. Why would we need an RMS?” This is a common misconception, especially among small, independent properties. During peak periods, rooms are full, rates are high, and revenue is rolling in. On the surface, it seems like there’s no room for improvement. But full occupancy doesn’t always equal maximum revenue. How much rate do you leave on the table to achieve that perfect fill? And what about the less visible gaps – last-minute cancellations, quiet shoulder nights, unexpected dips in demand? How well are you filling rooms then? To truly maximize revenue, hotels need to be able to anticipate these shifts and react quickly. And that requires automation. Find out whyhigh season is actually one of the best times to automate pricing. ## Eurovision 2025: Not All Hotels Thrive During Big Events There’s a lot of buzz these days about how concert tours like Taylor Swift’s and Beyoncé’s drive up hotel rates and occupancy. But not every property fully capitalizes on these opportunities. Take the 2025 Eurovision Song Contest in Basel, Switzerland. Hotels expected huge demand, and many set high rates and strict stay restrictions far in advance. When demand fell short of expectations, some properties reacted too slowly. Others panicked and slashed rates, while a few held firm and ended up with empty rooms. Meanwhile, hotels using dynamic pricing and availability controls – powered by an automated RMS – were able to adjust quickly and maximize revenue. Scenarios like this play out year-round, whether it’s a conference, festival, concert, or sporting event. Waiting for the “perfect time” to adopt an RMS only delays the benefits of smarter pricing. ## You’re Already Doing the Work – Now Make It Pay Off Another common excuse for delaying tech adoption? “We’re short-staffed.” This can happen in high season, in low season, or anytime in between. Hotel GMs often put things off to avoid overburdening their teams. That’s understandable. But manual pricing is already taking up valuable time. Checking competitor rates, deciding whether to raise or lower prices, managing spreadsheets, and updating the PMS – it all adds up. And it’s stressful. The problem isn’t the effort. It’s the efficiency. Manual processes slow you down, increase errors, and make it harder to respond when demand shifts. And when you’re juggling guests, staffing, and operations, pricing often falls to the bottom of the list. ## Smarter Hotel Revenue Tools, Better Results To grow bookings – without burning out – you don’t need to work harder. You need to empower your team to deliver better results with current efforts. And you want to take the guesswork and stress out of pricing. That’s where revenue management software comes in. It doesn’t add tasks, it makes your pricing smarter, faster, and more effective. Think of it like upgrading your tools. Many hoteliers are digging with a spoon when they really need a shovel. The right RMS is the shovel that lets you dig deeper with the same effort. Need help choosing the right RMS for your property?
